item.title: Towards an optimal solution for Open Flood
item.description: A couple months ago I came by an interesting problem that my friends were working on for their Algorithms course homework. The problem statement (linked here) was: (This question was inspired by the game Open Flood [available as an app on Android].) You are given a directed graph $\text{G}$ with $n$ vertices and $m$ edges (here $m \geq n$). Every edge $e \in \text{E(G)}$ has a color $c(\text{e})$ associated with it.

item.title: Home
item.description: Hello! I’m Srujun Thanmay Gupta, a software engineer at Google working on User Data and Privacy. Previously, I graduated from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign majoring in Computer Engineering. As an undergraduate student, I studied stream data processing systems with Prof. Indy and Shadi A. Noghabi, PhD. This blog is an attempt to motivate me to write more. I want to post about things like my individual research work, projects, thoughts, and experiments.
